page.title: 18Maghull Homes and Hospitals
page.content: { The Maghull Homes}have cared for epileptic residents since 1888 when Mr Henry Cox bought Manor House,Maghull.At the time they provided a home in the country convenient to Liverpool where the benefits of hospital treatment could be combined with a healthy outdoor life,regular habits,suitable employment and recreation. The 5 Homes have provided care for patients until the present time but recently one house has been closed and the other has been altered to accomodate elderly patients. {Moss Side and Park Lane}are 2 of 4 Special Hospitals in England(Rampton and Broadmoor being the other two).They are on adjoining sites in Maghull and 9 miles north of Liverpool.They are administered by the DHSS due to their special nature.
